title: VSCODE_PID not set on Linux, preventing debug-auto-attach from working
body:
Issue Type: Bug I was investigating the [Auto Attach](https://code.visualstudio.com/blogs/2018/07/12/introducing-logpoints-and-auto-attach) feature not working on my Ubuntu box. I noticed that VSCODE_PID was used: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/bc24f98b5f70467bc689abf41cc5550ca637088e/extensions/debug-auto-launch/src/extension.ts#L120-L128 If I understand correctly, the `extension.node-debug.startAutoAttach` is created there: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug/blob/dd8fca03672e05eca5d1e8e36f99c3a7f835459d/src/node/extension/autoAttach.ts#L57-L67 Thing is I don't think `VSCODE_PID` is set on Linux (not set in integrated terminal shells; in dev tools `process.env.VSCODE_PID` doesn't exist). The `rootPid` given is set by default to 0. Sorry for not having investigating further. 🙄 I'll try to clone vscode and debug from there. cc @weinand VS Code version: Code 1.29.1 (bc24f98b5f70467bc689abf41cc5550ca637088e, 2018-11-15T19:07:43.495Z) OS version: Linux x64 4.15.0-39-generic

title: [snippets] Support for global or project-level variables
body:
I originally posted in #59557, but I realized the OP was asking for a variable *defined within the snippet*.

## This request is for adding support for user-overridable variables defined *outside* of the snippet code, perhaps in:

1. A global/project-level config file
2. Environment variables

NOTE: # 2 [has a precedent in TextMate](https://macromates.com/manual/en/environment_variables).

# JavaScript Use Cases

## Use Case 1: `let` vs `const`

ES2015 introduced `let` and `const`. This comes down to a personal preference for many users.

This could be accommodated by allowing the user to set a variable like `${VARIABLE_DECL_KIND}` to either `const` or `let`.

## Use Case 2: `;`

Ending statements with `;` is also a stylistic preference for most JavaScript code.

This could be accommodated using a `${STATEMENT_TERMINATOR}` that could be defined as either `;` or an empty string.

I know many similar requests are being closed in favor of #10561, but I'm wondering if short of that, this could be implemented by adding another `VariableResolver` implemention, e.g.: `EnvironmentVariableResolver` or `ConfigFileVariableResolver`?

title: vscode never gets focus when started from cmd line with 'code'.
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.29.1

- OS Version: Mac OS 10.14

Steps to Reproduce:

1. start either terminal.app or iterm2.
2. run 'code .'
3. give vscode focus, type cmd + p
4. notice that cmd + p is sent to iTerm2 and not vs code. 
all key strokes are also sent to iTerm2 instead of vscode.
when i try to give vscode focus by selecting it with my mouse, the app with focus in the title bar is always Terminal.app/iTerm.app
5. appears as though vscode never gets focus


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: "Always on Visible Workspace" windowing option Is Continually Being Cleared by VS Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Issue Type: Bug On graphical Ubuntu Linux the windowing option in the control menu there is an option for: "Always On Visible Workspace" (being an Desktop workspace, not a VSCode workspace). That means my vscode window is visible in every ddesktop. Selecting that option works for a little while, say 30 min or so. It always seems to be reset or cleared. When it does reset; the VSCode window can vanish from the current desktop and is only to be found on the desktop it thinks of a 'home'(??). It is very annoying and irksome when the editor you rely on just vanishes like that. I used to think that code had crashed. Not so. In contrast many other windows have "Always on Visible Workspace" file browser, terminal, some browswer windows. These work as expected. And from memory when I used Atom, it was also well behaved. How is VSCode dropping the ball? VS Code version: Code 1.29.1 (bc24f98b5f70467bc689abf41cc5550ca637088e, 2018-11-15T19:07:43.495Z) OS version: Linux x64 4.18.0-11-generic

title: Use the web packed version of vscode-emmet-helper

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Once https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-emmet-helper/issues/27 is completed, use the web packed version of vscode-emmet-helper in the Emmet extension.

This can help us in avoiding the case where we have to exclude vscode-emmet-helper from the bundling done to the Emmet extension.

Note: If we plan to remove the lazy loading of vscode-emmet-helper, check the start up times before making the call

title: Allow to unpin an editor
body:
By default if the file was not modified and you use `Jump to definition`, the tab will be overwritten with new file. If the file was modified however (or if user clicks two times on the tab name) the tab gets pinned and `Jump to definition` will open new files instead. You can `Pin` a tab by pressing cmd + s easily. 

However I don't see any hotkey I can use to bring a file from `Modified` state back to `Unmodified`. I would really appreciate having this hotkey added to VS Code. I don't see any way I can achieve this behavior now.

title: Analyse extensions and find bad usages of vscode
body:
Just by accident, I observed the Powershell extension was using `vscode` as a regular dependency instead of as a dev dependency. By moving `vscode` to a dev dependency, they [have reduced their install size from 62.1 MB to 12.9 MB](https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/pull/1608#issuecomment-439710479)

I suggest we do the following:
1. Scan for existing extensions in the marketplace and create issues/PRs
2. Add a lint check in the `extension-editing` extension that is bundled with VS Code.

title: Avoid initializing Application Insights module when telemetry is disabled in settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
At present, the Application Insights modules gets initialized even if the user has set `telemetry.enable.Telemetry` to `false`.

This was done to support sending of telemetry events in the case where user changes the above setting from `false` to `true`.

We can solve this in one of 2 ways.
1. Lazy load Application Insights module
2. Or dont support the above case and prompt for a VS Code reload

title: Fixed #62679 - Added Option to Only Add a New Cursor at Current Column
body:
This PR partially fixes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/62679.

It adds support to for only adding a new cursor at current column for `Add Cursors To Bottom` and `Add Cursors To Top`.

When the option turned on, it will now skip a line if it is not able to insert a cursor below the current column.

Thanks for considering this request.

title: Staging when ignoring whitespace, doesn't stage changed whitespace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Issue Type: Bug 1. Indent several lines of code, and save. These should appear as changes in Git. 2. Click on "Open changes". 3. Ensure whitespace changes are hidden (which is the default). 4. Select the indented lines, and stage them with "Stage selected ranges". 5. Nothing is staged. Even though whitespace is hidden, shouldn't changes like indentation be staged, if they're within the selected range? Otherwise I end up with lines like `if (true)` staged, since it's a text change, but the block contained within its braces as not staged, since it's just an indentation change. VS Code version: Code 1.29.1 (bc24f98b5f70467bc689abf41cc5550ca637088e, 2018-11-15T19:06:21.742Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.0.0

title: Indent/Outdent with tab key does not honor editor.autoIndent=false
body:
Issue Type: Bug When I have: /* * Comment */ If I select it and hit tab, I get: /* * Comment */ If instead I had hit shift-tab, I get: /* * Comment */ Same happens with `Ctrl-]` and `Ctrl-[` *(if those are supposed to make a difference)* I hoped turning off autoIndent would stop this, but no dice. I also turned off C++ formatting in the JSON config: { "editor.autoIndent": false, "editor.detectIndentation": false, "C_Cpp.formatting": "Disabled" } I have done due diligence by asking (and bountying, +100) a question on StackOverflow to get an answer on what to do about this, but no one seems to know: https://stackoverflow.com/q/53326134/preserve-spacing-on-indent-or-outdent-with-tab-in-vscode If someone can provide a resolution here, be sure to go there and get the bounty points. title: Enable Shift-Insert to paste primary clipboard on Linux, fixes #36170.
body:
This PR fixes #36170 -- the Shift-Insert key combo will paste the primary clipboard as expected on Linux. 

I also removed code related to using the mouse middle-click to paste the primary clipboard because it actually did nothing. [`clipboard.readText('selection')`](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/clipboard#clipboardreadtexttype) just reads the text, it does not generate a paste event as the comment originally on line 55 suggests. Pasting the primary clipboard with middle-mouse works out-of-the-box as far as I can tell.

title: API to retrieve vscode.DebugSession

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: I am writing a debugger for vscode that launches `vscode.DebugSession` underneath (through `startDebugging` API). However, there does not seem to be any API in `vscode.debug` for retrieving and/or terminating a `vscode.DebugSession` that is running in the background and not the current `activeDebugSession`. Is there any way to achieve this or any plan to add this feature?

title: Extension wishlist/idea contribution
body:
It would be great if we could contribute ideas, in a way of wishlist, somewhere officially, so that extension developers can see what the community is looking for.

As an example I've worked today with glob patterns and it pretty much drove me nuts having to build a minimal node app just for the sake of creating the proper pattern. A simple small extension could be helpful here where you could select a base folder, paste your glob pattern, hit enter and see a list of hits.

Now of course one can always do it by oneself but I expect there are a lot of users overwhelmed with the extension API or the whole process of creating one. On the other hand there might be people looking for cool ideas to build their next VSCode extension for.

The marketplace might be a fit for this (submit your extension idea) or maybe directly from within VSCode Menu->Help->Submit Extension idea

title: Is it possible to copy text from `Show Hover`?
body:
For example I hover over an error like this:

![image 2018-11-16 12 31 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6391776/48619064-90013100-e99b-11e8-99ee-890a0e148a46.jpg)

And I would like to put `[ts] Property 'class' does not exist on type 'IntrinsicAttributes & Props. [2339]'` into my clipboard from a hotkey. Currently I am forced to use the mouse and highlight the hovered text and then pressing copy. I would love to do this from the keyboard.

My use case is that I want to quickly grab the text from `Show Hover` and then run a macro to Google for it or search it on Stack Overflow. For that I need to grab the text from hover window to my clipboard with a hotkey.

Thank you.

title: Perf problems aftermath
body:
We have shipped two not-so-good performance issues this month and we should make sure to not repeat that. This is a collection of ideas and changes:

* I have pushed https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/d7f82c11d667d0c86e8d6965c9474d34d111d7ad which is a telemetry event that tells us that a user got a hang or crash. @bpasero might know if we are already sending this somewhere else but I didn't find anything. Anyways, it shouldn't stop there but we should regularly look at those events and monitor them for a trend.
* https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/b548ced43cb1c9f86f3a013e20ccd8613fbd4138 is a change that logs warnings when an event emitter has a suspicious amount of listeners. While developing and while using insiders we should never seem them
* similar to the automatic extension host profiling (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/60332) we should invest if we can automatically profile the renderer as soon as it appear as unresponsive. That would help us nail down these issues faster

title: After fresh update, "Open Recent..." quits Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
- VSCode Version: 1.29.1 (but behaviour is present for a while)
- OS Version: Debian 9.6, Gnome 3.22.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install and open version *n*-1 of VSCode.
2. Open VSCode
3. Upgrade to version *n* (I'm using `apt` here in a seperate terminal window)
4. Open a recent file/workspace (<kbd>Ctrl+r</kbd>)
5. Upon selecting a recent item, the VSCode window disappears and its processes exit.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

---

Code autostarts when I log into my desktop. I am also in the habit of running system updates first thing after logging in (which occasionally brings in a new Code version; I don't have logic in place to parse `apt` output to trigger a restart of Code).

While working on the previous project, everything works fine, but when I need to switch workspaces the application just quits.

This behaviour does not hinder me to work (I can just reopen the application), but it is still annoying.

title: A11y_ViennaVsCodeExtension_ExplorerTAB_Usability: Instruction not provided for right click menu in toolbar section for screen reader users.
body:
“Check out Keros! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: ViennaVsCodeExtension
Application Version: 1.28.0
Operating System: Windows10
Url:  https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-toolsai.vscode-ai#overview

Repro Steps:
1) Launch VisualStudio Code.
2) Start Narrator
3) Navigate to Explorer Tab hit Space bar key-> Navigate to toolbar section-->Right click on any toolbar.

Actual
In the Toolbar section, when we right click on any toolbar new menu get opend. but there is no any screen reader user instruction available for this right click menu feature.

This is common across application

Expected
There should be instruction available before entering into the Toolbar section for this "Right click" menu feature.

User Impact
Screen reader user will not be able to understand about this feature.

title: Inscrease margin when "editor.glyphMargin" is "false"
body:
I LOVE (very very much) the `editor.glyphMargin` option, allowing to disable the debugger column. It saves a lot of unneeded space for those who wants, especially with multiple vertical editors.

But there is a little visual glitch here : 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5599375/48559199-6983bd00-e8eb-11e8-8798-ce0b4a2fdb9c.png)

Add a small `margin-left` on the line number column should be a good idea. `3px` or `4px` should be enough.

Have a good day :)

Actually : just tested it, `6px` is the best match

title: Selector specificity works wrong with sass nested selectors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Issue Type: Bug Css specifity calculator doesn't respect nested selectors or selectors with `&`. ```css #id {} /* (1, 0, 0) */ #id div {} /* (1, 0, 1) */ ``` ```sass #id { div { /* (0, 0, 1) */ } } .block{ /* (0, 1, 0) */ &__element { /* (0, 0, 0) */ } } ``` Reproduced without any extensions VS Code version: Code 1.29.0 (5f24c93878bd4bc645a4a17c620e2487b11005f9, 2018-11-12T07:47:15.448Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134

title: Provide an easy way to debug a freezing window (The window is no longer responding)
body:
When **The window is no longer responding** dialog appears, it would be great if there is an option to debug the window (e.g. start the DevTools and enter a debugging session). This should up me and other developers to find out and understand the cause of a freezing window more easily.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193136/48535990-c37e8580-e8df-11e8-9017-d9643b3535ed.png)

title: StartFindWithSelectionAction should not focus the find widget
body: This fixes #44093

title: Config for Glyph Margin, Line number, Git Diff, and Folding order and/or spacing
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9437330/48502912-8ccc4080-e7f5-11e8-8fd0-4fc1baeea312.png)
The Glyph Margin, Line number, Git Diff, and Folding UI items in the left of the editor should be able to be reordered or have spacing added between them. My main reason to suggest this, is that since the folding and git diff buttons are right next to each other and also very small, it's extremely easy to accidentally hit one when trying to hit the other.

title: Explore improving UX for Welcome Page

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
This exploration will aim to modernize the look and feel of the Welcome page while also improving the layout for new and current users. Items we're looking to explore:

- Add "privacy" section to page for better visibility
- Add "recently update" section for app and extension updates
- Add underline for text links on hover (consistency)

## Related issues
- Ability to remove recent item #22489
- Ability to pin projects #63057
- Don't open browser on first launch without user's action #14934
- Revisit "Interface Overview" page #19491

## Current Design

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35271042/48791391-7a934c00-eca6-11e8-9cb5-abaa01645d78.png)


## Research
Our research shows that new users install language & keyboard shortcut extensions the most, while current users go to recent projects or open folders. Below is a visualization of the top actions.

### Top actions for new users
![new users](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35271042/48498898-12e38980-e7ec-11e8-88f8-8b1c85b3a62b.png)


### Top actions for current users
![current users](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35271042/48499353-1cb9bc80-e7ed-11e8-80d7-1a543a88659f.png)


I will be updating this issue with explorations as they're developed.
